pullRequest.body:
This helps defining the module structure of stalks

This contribution was inspired by the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in June 2024.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

I realize the size of this PR is too quite big. If people like this idea, I will split it then.

> By the way, is it true that the only results that will be reused outside of this file is `moduleColimitColimit` and `smul_spec`? Maybe make this clear in the docstring.

done

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15315~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I have decided to put the results in `CategoryTheory/Limits/ConcreteCategory/WithAlgebraicStructures.lean` instead of `Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/OverFilteredColimits.lean`:
1. the results doesn't really mention `ModuleCat` at all
2. to avoid the file name `OverFilteredColimits` being read as something to do with `Over` category
By the way, is it true that the only results that will be reused outside of this file is `moduleColimitColimit` and `smul_spec`? Maybe make this clear in the docstring.
Well done for battling through this, it looks to me like a most welcome addition.
By the way, is it true that the only results that will be reused outside of this file is `moduleColimitColimit` and `smul_spec`? Maybe make this clear in the docstring.

```suggestion
/--if `x` is an element of `colimit F`, we arbitrarily choose some element representing `x`.-/
```

```suggestion
/-- if `x` is an element of `colimit F`, we arbitrarily choose an index `j` so that some element of
```

```suggestion
abelian groups `{Mâ±¼}`  with `j` running through same index category `J`. if for each `j âˆˆ J`, `Mâ±¼` is an `Râ±¼` such
```
(sorry, probably now over 100 chars)
Mathematics question: is the main result of this file true without assuming that the colimits are filtered?

My intuition is no. For example, the coproduct in the category of noncommutative ring behaves quite badly but coproduct in the category of abelian group is fine. The result in this file says the module structure shouldn't depend on whether the colimit is in RingCat or CommRingCat, but since colimit if not filtered generally will be different in RingCat and CommRingCat, it might still be possible to setup a module structure, but we will need to say which category we are talking about.

```suggestion
`colimit R`-module and a `colimit (R â‹™ forgetâ‚‚ CommRingCat RingCat)`-module; the two module
```
The name of this file confused me because I initially thought it was to do with over categories.
This file might be in the wrong location. Maybe it belongs to `CategoryTheory/ConcreteCategory`? Afterall, `ModuleCat` wasn't mentioned in this file at all
Since this is pretty specific about modules, I think this is the right location for this file.

```suggestion
def hSMul {câ‚ câ‚‚ câ‚ƒ : J} (iâ‚ : câ‚ âŸ¶ câ‚ƒ) (iâ‚‚ : câ‚‚ âŸ¶ câ‚ƒ)
```
?
Isn't it quite rare for namespaces to start with a small letter? And now you have two in a row? Should this be HSMul?
I changed everything to a `section`
Should this be `one_hsmul` and not in an hsmul namespace at all? You're already in this overFilteredColimits namespace.

This is just too costly, it seems. If you squeeze them then the proof is about 5 times faster and you don't need the heartbeats bump.
```suggestion
  Â· erw [IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := iâ‚), IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := fmâ‚)]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, Finset.mem_singleton, true_or, O]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      true_or, O, H]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      true_or, or_true, O, H]
  Â· erw [IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := iâ‚‚), IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := fnâ‚)]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, Finset.mem_singleton, true_or, or_true, O]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      true_or, or_true, O, H]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      true_or, or_true, O, H]
  Â· erw [IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := jâ‚), IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := fmâ‚‚)]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, Finset.mem_singleton, true_or, or_true, O]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      true_or, or_true, O, H]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      true_or, or_true, O, H]
  Â· erw [IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := jâ‚‚), IsFiltered.toSup_commutes O H (f := fnâ‚‚)]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, Finset.mem_singleton, true_or, or_true, O]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, Finset.mem_singleton, heq_eq_eq, true_and,
      true_or, or_true, O, H]
    Â· simp only [Finset.mem_insert, PSigma.mk.injEq, heq_eq_eq, true_and, Finset.mem_singleton,
      or_true, O, H]
```

```suggestion
```
(see below)

```suggestion
abelian groups `{Mâ±¼}`  with the same indexing set `j âˆˆ J`, if for each `j âˆˆ J`, `Mâ±¼` is an `Râ±¼`-module such
```
(now over 100 chars)

```suggestion
that the `Râ±¼`-actions are compatible with the morphisms in `J`, then there is a scalar multiplication
```

```suggestion
abelian groups `{Mâ±¼}`  with the same indexing category `J`. If for each `j âˆˆ J`, `Mâ±¼` is an `Râ±¼`-module such
```
(now over 100 chars)

```suggestion
noncomputable def sMulColimit {c : J} (r : â„›.obj c) (m : colimit (C := ð”„ð”Ÿ) â„³) :
```
I'm not 100% sure of the naming conventions but is it this?

```suggestion
```
Not sure if leaving it makes things clearer but you don't need it.

```suggestion
```
You can remove it and then just replace all occurrences of `H` with `{}` if you like.

```suggestion
abelian groups `{Mâ±¼}`  with the same indexing category `J`. If for each `j âˆˆ J`, `Mâ±¼` is an `Râ±¼` such
```

```suggestion
that the `Râ±¼`-actions are compatible with the morphisms in `J`, then there is a natural scalar multiplication
```

```suggestion
```
You don't seem to need it.

```suggestion
    rw [Concrete.Î¹_repColimit_eq], smulColimit.smul_rep]
  apply hsmul.respect_Î¹
  Â· rw [Concrete.Î¹_repColimit_eq]
  Â· rw [Concrete.Î¹_repColimit_eq, Concrete.Î¹_repColimit_eq]
```
At this point in the review I was wondering why the heck you needed so many `erw`s so I removed a few and it turns out that you don't need them at all. How many other `erw`s should be `rw`?
You can remove H and replace all the occurrences with `{}` if you like.
done

```suggestion
    rw [colimit.w_apply, Concrete.Î¹_repColimit_eq]
```
erw is a code smell. Surely you should be avoiding it if you can? Here and goodness knows how many other places.
All `erw` has been removed now! I might be hallucinating but I swear not all `erw` can be changed `rw` a few days ago ðŸ˜•

Why do you define `r` and `m` in this lemma, and then have hypotheses that they're equal to other things? Is the lemma more useful in this form, or can you just delete `r` and `m` completely, and replace them with their values according to h1 and h2 (which you can also remove)?
Thanks, copilot wrote this lemma actually xd

```suggestion
noncomputable def smulColimit {c : J} (r : â„›.obj c) (m : colimit (C := ð”„ð”Ÿ) â„³) :
```
According to the naming convention, the `s` and `m` in `smul` should be (un)capitalized simultaneously. Same below.

```suggestion
noncomputable def colimitSMulColimit (r : colimit (C := â„œð”¦ð”«ð”¤) â„›) (m : colimit (C := ð”„ð”Ÿ) â„³) :
```
Can you provide a version where j1 = j2 = j3?
This has been added
Can you say anything about what the heck is going on with these universes? My naive expectation would be that if (R : Type u) is a category then it would forget to Type u.
This is copied from concrete category file, I am not too sure the motivation, but it is certainly more general than forgeting to type `u`

```suggestion
noncomputable def indexRepColimit [HasColimit F] (x : colimit F) : J :=
```
or is there something funny going on?

hmmm, removing the up arrow does not work, I think this is because for `(x : colimit F)` to work, Lean assumed that `colimt F` is `Type _` so that it want `F` to be `J ==> Type _`, this works `(x : (colimit F : C))` though

```suggestion
  â„›.map iâ‚ r â€¢ â„³.map iâ‚‚ m
```
In order to avoid this issue, it seems to me that you could use any colimit cocone in `RingCat` instead of `colimit R`.

pullRequest.title: feat: module structure of filtered colimit of abelian groups over filtered colimit of rings

source.title: feat: show stalk of presheaf of modules is a module over stalk of ring
